cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it deals with a content-based recommender system that learns representations of text documents and models user interest. It also involves Latent Semantic Analysis (LSA), which is a common technique used in information retrieval. 

The paper also involves machine learning techniques such as generative models and Gaussian mixture models, which are commonly used in the sub-categories of Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). 

Additionally, the paper deals with natural language processing tasks, which is a common area of research in the sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). 

Finally, the paper involves the use of a standard benchmark dataset for recommender systems, which is a common area of research in the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
